result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Forrest J. Goetz

records.addlTxt:
Information to be filed and mirror the charges in the criminal complaint.
DA Cousins will file the Information today.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:18 PM Defendant Forrest J. Goetz in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Forrest J. Goetz.  District Attorney (DA) Cass W Cousins in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of hearing 10/24/22 at 3pm - Return to sender insufficient address unable to forward
DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN THE AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,000
Register with the Sex Offender Registry and comply with all requirements.

1:19 PM Defendant Forrest J. Goetz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Forrest J. Goetz. Attorney Andrew Mutchler on behalf of Cass W Cousins in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:40 PM Defendant Forrest J. Goetz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Pfeil calls the case and states the appearances.
Defendant appears without counsel today.
Court questions the defendant with regards to an attorney.
Defendant would wish to have an attorney represent him.
Defendant states that he needs to speak with the DA's Office.
Defendant will have the opportunity to contact the Public Defender's Office to see if he is eligible for a public defender.
Defendant states that Atty Gary Kryshak represents him on other cases.
ADA Pfeil would request a $1,000 signature bond with no special conditions.

BY THE COURT: 
Case is to be adjourned.
Defendant to contact the Public Defender's Office to have Atty Kryshak appointed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial Appearance set for 08/29/22 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1
